agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM
agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, and Pike County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, or Pike County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides employment training and support services for migrant and seasonal farm workers.

site_eligibility: Living in Adams, Allen, Benton, Blackford, Boone, Carroll, Cass, Clinton, Delaware, Fountain, Grant, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Henry, Howard, Huntington, Jay, Johnson, Madison, Marion, Miami, Montgomery, Parke, Putnam, Randolph, Shelby, Tippecanoe, Tipton, Vermillion, Wabash, Warren, Wayne, Wells, and White County -- Migrant and seasonal farm workers and agricultural workers -- Having a low income determination or disability -- Authorized to work in the United States, including all US territories

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization that provides services to those in need. Services include early head start, head start, health clinic, Energy Assistance Program, weatherization, and small business loans.
site_name: PACE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY - KNOX COUNTY - VINCENNES - FOURTH STREET
service_description: Assists individuals who are interested in starting a small business or expanding their current business. Loan amount is determined by eligibility criteria and available funding.
site_details: Visit the website to download an application -- Submit the application via mail, email, or fax. -- Call or email for questions.
site_eligibility: Persons who own or want to start a business in Daviess, Greene, Knox, or Sullivan County -- 51% owned by a US citizen -- Gross less than $1 million annually -- Other criteria may be based on type of loan

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization that provides services to those in need. Services include early head start, head start, health clinic, Energy Assistance Program, weatherization, and small business loans.
site_name: PACE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY - KNOX COUNTY - VINCENNES - FOURTH STREET
service_description: Offers individual development savings accounts for low-income adults. Participants receive matching funds for money they save toward buying a home, paying for post-secondary education, or starting or expanding a small business. Financial and homeowner education is provided during their four-year participation to help participants achieve their goals.
site_details: Visit the website to download an application -- Submit the application via mail, email, or fax. -- Call or email for questions.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana -- With earned income (from full or part-time employment) -- Total household income at or below 200% of the federal poverty guidelines

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization that provides services to those in need. Services include early head start, head start, health clinic, Energy Assistance Program, weatherization, and small business loans.
site_name: PACE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY - KNOX COUNTY - VINCENNES - FOURTH STREET
service_description: Provides early childhood support through a center-based program that offers care and education in a childcare center and a home-based program that combines parenting education, economic self-sufficiency planning, and health and social services for low-income families.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm -- Program: Varies; call for schedule
site_eligibility: Living or working in Daviess, Greene, Knox, or Sullivan County -- Families with children ages birth to 3 -- One of the following must apply: (i)At or below 100% federal poverty guidelines, (ii)Child is in foster, (iii)Receiving TANF or SSI, -OR- (iv)Child has a documented disability

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization that provides services to those in need. Services include early head start, head start, health clinic, Energy Assistance Program, weatherization, and small business loans.
site_name: PACE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY - KNOX COUNTY - VINCENNES - FOURTH STREET

site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm -- Program: Varies; call for schedule
site_eligibility: Living or working in Daviess, Greene, Knox, or Sullivan County -- Age 3-5 (Age 3 by August 1st) -- One of the following must apply: (i)At or below 100% federal poverty guidelines, (ii)Child is in foster, (iii)Receiving TANF or SSI, -OR- (iv)Child has a documented disability

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging, providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, and Pike County.
service_description: Assists seniors and persons with disabilities in applying for and accessing funding for supportive living services. Funding options may include Medicaid Waivers, CHOICE vouchers, or block grants. Ongoing case management, care coordination, and in-home services are provided for those who qualify. In some cases, subsidies may be used to pay a family member to provide the care.
site_details: Call for an initial assessment. An in-home assessment and application will be scheduled.
site_eligibility: Living in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, or Pike County -- Ages 60 and older or with physical disabilities -- Unable to perform tasks of daily living without assistance (based on assessment) -- Income requirements vary by funding source

agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
service_description: Provides classes on recognizing and changing patterns of problematic or abusive behavior for men and women who use violence or other abusive behavior in relationships. Participants may self-refer, be court-ordered, or referred by the Department of Child Services (DCS). This 26-week program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV). Clients may begin the program at any time.
site_details: Call to schedule orientation. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)
site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in Knox County -- Age 6 months and older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call for details.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Knox County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older -- Living in Knox County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in withiin the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Knox County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, and vector control.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call or send an email to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization providing charitable outreach, including a food and clothing pantry, thrift store, and limited financial assistance.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food, hygiene items, and gently used clothing (baby through adult sizes) to those in need. Assistance is based on income. Limited service area.

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization providing charitable outreach, including a food and clothing pantry, thrift store, and limited financial assistance.
service_description: Provides temporary financial assistance with rent and utility bills for those unable to receive aid from other local resources. Applicants must first apply for all available energy assistance programs (EAP) or other financial aid with their township trustee and the regional community action agency (Pace) before contacting this agency. Assistance is based on income. Limited service area.
site_details: After applying for aid from township trustee and Pace: Call to request assistance. If voicemail is received, leave a message with name, phone number, and type of assistance requested. Calls are returned Mon-Thurs 9am-4pm.
site_eligibility: Living in Knox County -- Low income based on assessment -- Applied for assistance from the Township Trustee and Pace Community Action Agency (Pace) before requesting assistance from this agency - Limit one utility assistance per year -- Limit one rent assistance per year

site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Knox County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Knox County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Knox County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Knox County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Knox County Courts

site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_name: HOPE'S VOICE OF KNOX AND DAVIESS COUNTY
agency_desc: Provides assistance to victims of domestic violence and sexual assault, including crisis counseling, safety planning, and advocacy.
site_name: HOPE'S VOICE OF KNOX AND DAVIESS COUNTY
service_description: Provides assistance to persons who are victims of domestic violence or sexual assault, including crisis counseling, safety planning, and advocacy. Services may include, but are not limited to, court accompaniment, assistance filing a protective order, case management, and transportation to safe housing options.
site_details: Call for information or assessment.
site_eligibility: Victims of domestic violence or sexual assault

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Knox County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Knox County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Knox County)

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: A not-for-profit electric distribution cooperative in southwestern Indiana.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in Knox and Sullivan counties and portions of Clay, Gibson, Greene, Pike, Posey, and Vigo counties.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is available at this location.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4:30pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open
